Air Liquide and basf welcome support from european Innovation fund for joint ccs project Regulatory This press Release features Multimedia view full release here Air Liquide parisai and basf are planning develop the World largest Crossborder Carbon capture and storage ccs value chain goal significantly reduce co2 emissions industrial Cluster The Port antwerp the joint project Kairosc has been selected for funding the european commission through its Innovation fund one seven largescale projects out Mor Than Application Kairosc jointly Developed air Liquide and basf its Antwerp chemical site avoiding Million Ton co2 over the first Years Operation significantly contribute goal becoming climate neutral besides combining co2 capture Liquefaction Transportation and storage large scale The North sea the project includes several innovativ Technologie notably for capturing co2 from Production plants Air Liquide use its Patented Cryocaptm technology and for drying the co2 BASF apply its Sorbead solution project planned operational Kairosc paving the way for next phases Carbon Abatement The Port Antwerp the project connected shared co2 Transport and Export infrastructur Including firstofitskind Co2 Liquefaction and Export Terminal which built under The Framework antwerpc Consortium that aims halve co2 Emission The Port antwerp Air Liquide and basf are founding Members Antwerpc Benoît Potier Chairman and Chief executive officer Air Liquide Declared Line with its sustainability objectives which include reaching carbon neutrality Air liquide Ambition contribute actively
